column4: question please: does ubuntu 8.04 (or above) have a driver for ï»¿nvidia? I just upGraded from 7.10 to 8.04. There was a problem with display. With ubuntu 7.10 I had to use the driver from nvidia web site (nothing else works).
you can use the program "jockey" to enable nvidia drivers.

I have nvidia drivers here and usually I need to manually run and rebuild modules (after update linux headers). This is what I did with ubuntu 7.10. This time it say "failed" but after reboot (second reboot after upGrage) it start working.
will check that program.. just not sure if it is ok now
jockey takes care of the configuration.
ok then... I was thinking like ubuntu driver is there that is why nvidia rebuild failed, etc,etc. Anyway. Thank you!!
